title: "Keeper of the Hammer"
body: Why is it that In a world of "X, the adjective noun", we suddenly have the keeper of the hammer? Is "The hammer keeper" not palatable? I know it's a small thing but it just seems odd. And along those lines, why the keeper of the hammer to begin with? Her VO is basically "hero blah blah hammer hammer hero blah blah hero hammer", so why cement this item as her new personality even more?

replies.body: "Hammer Keeper" makes it sound like Poppy is some kinda hammer hoarder.
So.. if she's not that what is she?
A delivery girl. At least she sees it that way.
She delivers the bad news am I right?
Depends on the receiver.
Well I mean a hammer to the face is bad news to basically anyone no?
Well yeah, but she's not always intending to hit people with it.  They just keep getting on her way.
I feel so bad for her now.

I actually went to check, because I remembered that Poppy isn't the only champion with a title like this:

Quinn and Valor, Demacia's Wings
Malphite, Shard of the Monolith
Jax, Grandmaster at Arms
Diana, Scorn of the Moon
Morgana, Fallen Angel (Thanks for the reminder ShadowStorm!)
Shen, Eye of Twilight
Sona, Maven of the Strings
Zyra, Rise of the Thorns

Nothing too major, was just curious who had titles like Poppy's.
There's also Morgana, Fallen Angel

Wait really? SOD. GAH. 

You know for the longest time I thought Nautilus's title was "Titan of the Depths" but apparently it's "The Titan of the Depths". Was that changed at some point or am I just delusional?
Not sure on Nautilus... I don't think it was ever changed, but I couldn't say for sure. I only knew Morgana since she's been a go-to champ of mine for 5 years now. =)
any chance Poppy's title can be turned into something not so in your face like: The Heroseeker or Seeker of the Worthy
How is that not "in your face"?
I always saw "the". But I don't play him so I can't say I notice.
Want something that will irk you for the rest of your life? Sion's title is "**T**he Undead Juggernaut" whereas all the other "the"s begin with a lowercase letter.

We're not counting single word titles like:
"Kayle, the Judicator"
"Graves, the Outlaw"
"Shyvana, the Half-Dragon"
or "Yorick, the Gravedigger?"
